DOC.brief_summary: Hypothesis : Insulin-resistant African-American Hispanic adolescent show significant improvement insulin sensitivity ( SI ) positive change associate fibrinolytic marker lipid profile two month supervise aerobic training .
DOC.brief_title: An Exercise Intervention Study Insulin-Resistant Adolescents
DOC.detailed_description: The specific aim study 1 ) To determine effect exercise insulin sensitivity insulin-resistant African-American Hispanic adolescent ; 2 ) To determine effect exercise fibrinolytic marker insulin-resistant African-American Hispanic adolescent . The hypothesis insulin-resistant African-American Hispanic adolescent show significant improvement insulin sensitivity ( SI ) positive change associate fibrinolytic marker lipid profile 1 month pre-training period two-months supervise , moderate intensity aerobic exercise . Part I. Insulin-resistant African American Hispanic adolescent DC metro area recruit various recruitment effort . Potential participant 2 screen visit medical history , physical activity level , body mass index , fast plasma glucose insulin OGTT result determine eligibility . Part 2 . If inclusion criterion meet , subject undergo 2 week dietary stabilization period , treadmill exercise testing , IVGTT , blood draw fibrinolytic lipid marker , DEXA scan , anthropometric measurement . Subjects 1 month pre-training period 2 month supervise , moderate intensity aerobic exercise . All baseline testing repeat exercise period see significant difference .
DOC.criteria: Must 14 18 year old Being African American Hispanic Sedentary ( exercise less twice week le 20 minute ) Nonsmoker At high risk develop insulin resistance BMI age grater equal 95th percentile History chronic illness Thyroid dysfunction Taking medication know affect metabolism Being pregnant lactating
